categorie / Cities

Best Parisian Quarters

Most flock here for the beauty of the Sacré-Cœur Basilica or its nearby nightlife, but there are lots of hidden treats and things to do in the north of Paris than you might expect.

The north of Paris is a misunderstood gem. Yes, it has its hoards of visitors climbing the stairs to spot the Sacré-Cœur Basilica, chowing down on cliche “French” food and sneaking a peek at the great Parisian skyline views, but what lingers down those cute cobble-stoned alleyways? Here are our suggestions of how you can extend your stay in this vibrant district-on-the-hill.

The north of Paris is a misunderstood gem. Yes, it has its hoards of visitors climbing the stairs to spot the Sacré-Cœur Basilica, chowing down on cliche “French” food and sneaking a peek at the great Parisian skyline views, but what lingers down those cute cobble-stoned alleyways? Here are our suggestions of how you can extend your stay in this vibrant district-on-the-hill.

Want to discover more great places to visit in Paris? Download the free Travelkiki places city guide for iPhone & Android.

Hidden among railways and busy roads in the north of Paris, Rue de l’Olive is a tiny local shopping street with a bountiful indoor market. Once the local cattle market, the hall frames an utterly tempting selection of cheeses, charcuterie, fruit and vegetables. If you get peckish from eyeballing all the fresh produce, sit down to homemade Caribbean, Thai or Italian specialties at one of the many local eateries.

Otherwise, enjoy a glass of red at En Vrac, the organic wine bar on the corner, or simply take a coffee break at one of the local brasseries. Whatever your choice, a sunny terrace and view of the animated street await.
